extendedIngredients.name: coarse kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 teaspoon plus 1 tablespoon coarse kosher salt plus additional for seasoning
extendedIngredients.originalName: coarse kosher salt plus additional for seasoning

title: Brussels Sprout Slaw with Mustard Dressing and Maple-Glazed Pecans
summary: Brussels Sprout Slaw with Mustard Dressing and Maple-Glazed Pecans requires around 45 minutes from start to finish. This gluten free and vegan recipe serves 8 and costs $1.41 per serving. This side dish has 221 calories, 4g of protein, and 16g of fat per serving. If you have apple cider vinegar, pepper, sugar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is brought to you by Epicurious. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. With a spoonacular score of 72%, this dish is pretty good. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Brussels Sprout Slaw With Mustard Dressing And Maple-glazed Pecans, Brussels Sprout Slaw with Mustard Dressing and Maple-Glazed Pecans, and Maple-Mustard-Mixed Pepper Glazed Salmon with Brussels Sprout Slaw.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Preheat oven to 325°F. Spray large sheetof foil with nonstick spray. Place pecanson small rimmed baking sheet. Whiskmaple syrup, 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt, and1/4 teaspoon pepper in small bowl. Add tonuts and toss to coat; spread in single layer.Bake nuts 5 minutes. Stir. Continue to bakenuts until toasted and glaze is bubblingthickly, about 6 minutes. Immediatelytransfer nuts to prepared foil and separate.Cool completely. DO AHEAD:  Can be made 2days ahead. Store airtight.                                                                Whisk mustard, vinegar, lemon juice,and sugar in small bowl; whisk in oil.Season with coarse salt and pepper.                                                                Bring large pot of water to boil. Add1 tablespoon coarse salt. Add brusselssprouts. Cook until crisp-tender and stillbright green, about 5 minutes. Drain; rinsewith cold water. Cool on paper towels.Using processor fitted with 1/8- to 1/4-inchslicing disk, slice brussels sprouts. Transferto large bowl. DO AHEAD: Dressing andbrussels sprouts can be made 1 day ahead.Cover separately; chill.                                                                Toss brussels sprouts with enoughdressing to coat. Let marinate 30 to 60minutes. Mix in some pecans. Place slaw inserving bowl. Top with remaining pecans.                                                Shopping tip:              Look for Grade B pure maplesyrup. It has a bolder maple flavor than thedelicate Grade A.                                                         Per serving: calories kcal 223.1,68.3 % calories from fat, 17.1 g fat,1.4 g saturated fat,0 mg cholesterol,17.4 g carbohydrates,4.2 g dietary fiber,9.9 g total sugars,13.2 g net carbohydrates,3.9 g protein                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Bon Appétit

steps.step: Preheat oven to 325°F. Spray large sheetof foil with nonstick spray.
Place pecanson small rimmed baking sheet.
Whiskmaple syrup, 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt, and1/4 teaspoon pepper in small bowl.
Add tonuts and toss to coat; spread in single layer.

Bake nuts 5 minutes. Stir. Continue to bakenuts until toasted and glaze is bubblingthickly, about 6 minutes. Immediatelytransfer nuts to prepared foil and separate.Cool completely. DO AHEAD:  Can be made 2days ahead. Store airtight.
Whisk mustard, vinegar, lemon juice,and sugar in small bowl; whisk in oil.Season with coarse salt and pepper.
Bring large pot of water to boil.
Add brusselssprouts. Cook until crisp-tender and stillbright green, about 5 minutes.
Drain; rinsewith cold water. Cool on paper towels.Using processor fitted with 1/8- to 1/4-inchslicing disk, slice brussels sprouts.
Transferto large bowl. DO AHEAD: Dressing andbrussels sprouts can be made 1 day ahead.Cover separately; chill.
Toss brussels sprouts with enoughdressing to coat.
Place slaw inserving bowl. Top with remaining pecans.
Look for Grade B pure maplesyrup. It has a bolder maple flavor than thedelicate Grade A.
